Michelle Keegan has revealed why she wanted to be a part of ITV drama, Tina & Bobby. 
The first episode of the series kicks off tonight on ITV, with Michelle starring as Tina Moore – nee Dean – and Lorne MacFadyen as the footballing legend Bobby Moore. 
The series starts with Tina and Bobby's first meeting as teenagers, who fell in love right from the start . 
Opening up about her reasons for taking on the role, the former Corrie star has explained that she wanted to challenge herself. The drama will focus on the couple's marriage (Photo: PA) Michelle Keegan as Tina Moore in the new production of 'Bobby Moore the life story' for ITV (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) 
"I wanted to take on the role because it was such a challenge. I've never done a period piece. When they offered me the role I jumped at the chance." 
The fact her husband, Mark Wright, is a huge fan of Bobby Moore's also helped sway her into taking on the part. Michelle with the real Tina (Photo: Kent Gavin/ Daily Mirror) Read More Secret life of Bobby Moore: England football legend battled cancer THREE times 
"I don't know what the off side rule, Mark's tried to explain it to me a few times. He's a huge West Ham supporter and he does say that Bobby was a legend," revealed Mich. 
The anticipated drama will also cover the couple's blossoming relationship, Bobby's rise to fame and Tina's struggle as a young mother and housewife covering up Bobby's tragic secret: the testicular cancer that puts his World Cup dreams at risk. It will cover everything from their marriage to Bobby's cancer battle (Photo: Stuart Wood) 
The ITV series Tina And Bobby is based on Tina's memoirs, Bobby Moore: By The Person Who Knew Him Best.
